title: Set up project scaffold and SPA shell
acceptance_criteria: Project scaffold created with a modular folder structure and a minimal SPA shell. | Index.html loads and the app bootstraps without errors. | Basic npm scripts (install, start) work locally and serve the app. | Routing and module layout anticipate future features.

title: Define data models for Course and SyllabusItem
acceptance_criteria: Data models for Course and SyllabusItem are defined with fields (e.g., id, name, startDate, syllabusItems). | Type definitions (TypeScript interfaces or JSDoc) enforce consistent shapes. | Sample in-memory data structures illustrate expected usage.

title: Implement LocalStorage persistence layer
acceptance_criteria: Persistence layer provides save and load functions for the app state. | Data is serialized to JSON and stored under a stable key in localStorage. | On startup, state is restored from localStorage with graceful handling of empty storage.

title: Create initial UI to create and list courses
acceptance_criteria: UI allows creating a new course with name and optional start date. | UI lists existing courses loaded from localStorage. | Selecting a course updates the view to reflect the chosen course. | All UI interactions are client-side with no server dependency.

title: Add syllabus item entry UI (title, week, due date, description)
acceptance_criteria: Form fields exist for syllabus item: title, week number, due date, description. | UI validates required fields and provides inline errors when missing. | Submitting adds the syllabus item to the selected course and updates downstream weekly plans.

title: Implement week mapping logic to generate weekly plans
acceptance_criteria: Syllabus items are mapped to their corresponding calendar weeks. | A weekly plan data structure is generated and kept in sync with syllabus items. | Changes to syllabus items reflow into updated weekly plans.

title: Implement validation for syllabus item entry
acceptance_criteria: Inline validation messages appear for missing or invalid fields. | Submit is blocked until all required fields are valid. | Validation logic covers positive week numbers and valid date formats.

title: Auto-persist changes to localStorage on data changes
acceptance_criteria: Any change to courses or syllabus items triggers automatic save to localStorage. | No manual save button is required for MVP. | Reloading the page restores the latest changes.

title: Build weekly planner view with tasks grouped by week
acceptance_criteria: Weekly view displays weeks with corresponding tasks grouped under each week. | Tasks show essential details such as title and due date. | Multiple courses can be reflected in the weekly view when selected.

title: Implement task completion toggles and per-course progress
acceptance_criteria: Each task can be marked complete/incomplete via a toggle. | Per-course progress is calculated and displayed (e.g., percentage complete). | Progress UI updates automatically as tasks are toggled.

title: Add course filter to weekly planner view
acceptance_criteria: A course filter allows viewing tasks for a single course in the weekly view. | Filter selection is preserved within the session and resets appropriately.

title: Ensure auto-save of progress and changes to localStorage
acceptance_criteria: Toggling a task or updating course details auto-saves to localStorage. | Reloading preserves completed states and edits. | No data loss occurs during rapid user interactions.

title: Add export to JSON and CSV for all courses/plans
acceptance_criteria: Export feature outputs a valid JSON file containing all courses and weekly plans. | CSV export is available and represents the same data structure. | Export files can be re-imported via the Import feature.

title: Add import from JSON/CSV to restore plans
acceptance_criteria: Import accepts JSON and CSV files with a valid schema. | Imported data replaces or merges with existing state per defined behavior. | Invalid formats produce a clear error message.

title: Implement duplication of a course plan
acceptance_criteria: User can duplicate an existing course, creating a new course with the same structure. | Syllabus items in the duplicate are copied with new IDs and persisted. | Original course remains unchanged.

title: Improve accessibility and keyboard navigation
acceptance_criteria: All interactive elements are keyboard accessible with proper focus order. | ARIA attributes added for inputs, regions, and dynamic content. | Visible focus indicators and screen-reader friendly labels are present.

title: Optimize initial load performance (target < 2s)
acceptance_criteria: Performance measurements show initial load time under 2 seconds on typical desktop hardware. | Code paths minimized for first render (e.g., lazy loading where appropriate).

title: Add onboarding flow or sample demo data
acceptance_criteria: Onboarding flow or sample demo course is available to enable quick-start planning. | Demo data can be cleared or reset easily.

title: Polish UI/UX with microcopy and visual polish
acceptance_criteria: UI includes consistent typography, spacing, and clarifying microcopy. | Tooltips or inline hints assist user actions without clutter.

title: Create testing plan and lightweight automated tests
acceptance_criteria: A basic testing plan documents core flows (course creation, syllabus entry, mapping, persistence, export/import). | At least a small set of automated tests or a plan for manual tests exists to validate MVP behavior.
